intro: Calystegia fulcrata, commonly known as the spreading morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the bindweed family (Convolvulaceae). It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, blooming in the early morning. Calystegia fulcrata is native to parts of North America and is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open fields. It is a perennial vine that can spread aggressively, making it both a common weed and a decorative plant in gardens.
